planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system and is also the closest planet to the sun. It is a rocky planet with a heavily cratered surface and no atmosphere.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is the second planet from the sun and is known for its thick, toxic atmosphere that traps heat and causes a greenhouse effect. It is the hottest planet in our solar system.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is the third planet from the sun and is the only planet known to support life. It has a diverse range of environments, including oceans, forests, deserts, and polar ice caps.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the sun and is often referred to as the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance in the night sky. It has a thin atmosphere and a rocky, desert-like surface.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system and is known for its Great Red Spot, a massive storm larger than the size of Earth. It is a gas giant with no solid surface.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the sun and is known for its beautiful rings made up of ice particles and rock. It is also a gas giant with no solid surface.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the sun and is tilted on its side, giving it a unique appearance. It is a gas giant with a rocky core and a thick atmosphere of hydrogen, helium, and methane.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the eighth planet from the sun and is known for its blue color, which comes from the presence of methane in its atmosphere. It is also a gas giant with a rocky core.
